sense.def:
To drag something or someone somewhere
pomeni s težavo nekoga nekam spraviti.

seg.quote: He listened as the body was dragged up the stairs.
She grabbed her husband by the wrist and dragged him away.

sense.def:
To drag someone somewhere
pomeni tudi nekoga prisiliti, da nekam gre;

seg.quote: I'm sorry to drag you to the telephone, but something awful has happened.

sense.def:
To drag oneself somewhere
pomeni počasi se nekam premikati, ker smo bolni ali šibki ali ker ne želimo iti tja.

seg.quote: I was able to drag myself shakily to my feet.

sense.def:
Če neki dogodek
drags
, je zelo dolgočasen in imamo občutek, da dolgo traja.

seg.quote: The part of the play which drags is the last half-hour.

cit.quote: v ženskih oblačilih, oblečen kot travestit

sense.def:
To drag something out
pomeni poskrbeti, da nekaj traja dlje, kot je treba.

seg.quote: How could we prevent them from dragging out the talks?
